title: DTC children’s food brand Little Spoon expands with breakfast SKUs, Oatly collaboration
summary: Little Spoon, a direct-to-consumer brand, introduced quick breakfast options for parents based on customer feedback. The new breakfast products include Pesto Eggs Biteable, Mini Classic Eggs + Sausage Biteable, Classic Breakfast Plate, and overnight oat smoothies. Little Spoon remains committed to its direct-to-consumer business model.
likely_naics_codes: Likely NAICS Codes: 311999 - All Other Miscellaneous Food Manufacturing, 311812 - Commercial Bakeries, 311411 - Frozen Fruit, Juice, and Vegetable Manufacturing, 311612 - Meat Processed from Carcasses

title: Watch on demand: How can plant-based protein win over consumers, retailers ‘burned’ by past experiences with the category?
summary: Sales of plant-based meat products continue to decline as consumer dissatisfaction grows, retailers reduce the number of plant-based options, and companies emphasize the importance of creating great-tasting, nutritious options to win back consumer trust and retailer support.

title: Butyl Rubber Market Poised For Steady Growth Driven By Automotive And Pharmaceutical Demands
summary: The global butyl rubber market is expected to witness continued growth due to its versatility and unique properties, with projections to reach USD 5.30 billion by 2032. The market overview includes key applications in automotive, construction, pharmaceutical, food packaging, and medical devices. Key trends driving growth include rising automotive demand, the electric vehicle boom, focus on sustainability, and expanding pharmaceutical industry. Major players in the market are outlined, with strategic developments highlighted.
green_innovation: FALSE: While the article discusses the market growth and properties of butyl rubber, it does not specifically state any innovations that contribute towards environmental sustainability goals.
business_innovation: FALSE: The article focuses on market trends, applications, and key players in the butyl rubber market, without explicitly describing a new or significantly improved product or business process.
green_product: FALSE: Although the article mentions the properties and applications of butyl rubber, it does not emphasize the design, manufacture, or use in a way that significantly reduces its environmental impact throughout its life cycle.
green_process: FALSE: The article does not highlight any specific methods or techniques in manufacturing or production of butyl rubber that minimize environmental impacts or promote sustainability.

title: Do consumers believe ‘better-for-you’ marketing on snacks?
summary: The article discusses the rise of functional foods, consumer trust issues in the food industry, the importance of transparent labeling, and the shift towards cleaner label products and nutritional information.
likely_naics_codes: Likely NAICS Codes: 311711 - Seafood Product Preparation and Packaging, 311411 - Frozen Food Manufacturing, 311812 - Commercial Bakeries, 311812 - Cookies and Crackers Manufacturing

title: How brands are capitalising on gut health
summary: The article discusses the growing popularity of the gut health trend, driven by increased consumer awareness and interest in products promoting gut health. The market for digestive health products is expanding rapidly, with manufacturers developing innovative gut-friendly products to cater to consumer demand.
likely_naics_codes: Likely NAICS Codes: 311999 (All Other Miscellaneous Food Manufacturing), 325411 (Medicinal and Botanical Manufacturing), 325412 (Pharmaceutical Preparation Manufacturing), 454390 (Other Direct Selling Establishments)
